Key Match Events: Son Heung-min scored a brace and assisted one goal to help South Korea beat China 3-0
South Korea broke the deadlock just 11 minutes into the match with a penalty converted by Son
Three minutes later, Son headed home his second goal from a corner
Jung Seung-hyun's header went into the back of the net on 86 minutes
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Korea showed dominance throughout the match with 65 percent of ball possession and a total of 18 shots, 13 more than the host team
Tan Long was close to find the equalizer for China in the 42nd minute, but his close range shot went off the near post
In the other Group C match on Tuesday, Thailand secured an away victory over Singapore 3-1
